intro: Armeriastrum cephalotes, commonly known as the mountain sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. Its leaves are narrow, linear, and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. Armeriastrum cephalotes is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in full sun conditions.
